instruction: Given a text paragraph and a fact, generate a statement that is using the content of the given paragraph yet, it is **incorrect** (i.e., it contradicts the statements of the input).
input: Erin is white. If something is blue then it is smart. If something is white and young then it is smart. Erin is smart. If something is white and blue then it is green. If something is young then it is white. Blue things are white. If something is white then it is blue. Erin is blue. All rough things are white. If Erin is blue then Erin is rough.

instruction: Given a text paragraph and a fact, generate a statement that is using the content of the given paragraph yet, it is **incorrect** (i.e., it contradicts the statements of the input).
input: If something is not green and not blue then it is white. If something is not green and not blue then it is big. Bob is not white. Bob is big. White things are green. Bob is not cold. Bob is blue. Bob is young. Bob is not green. Bob is quiet.
